ch.unibas.bsc.detapp.map

Class SpawnPoint

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.badlogic.gdx.scenes.scene2d.Actor
      • ch.unibas.bsc.detapp.map.SpawnPoint

  • public class SpawnPoint
extends com.badlogic.gdx.scenes.scene2d.Actor
    A SpawnPoint has a position on the screen and can be used to either randomly spawn new objects based on predefined probabilities per object type or it can be operated manually when for example a level is used.

      • manualSpawn

        protected void manualSpawn(GameObjectTypes gameObjectType)
        Map can call the manual spawn of objects e.g. when in level description mode.
        Parameters:
        gameObjectType - describes the object to be spawned. Must be of type GameObjectTypes

      • manualSpawn

        protected void manualSpawn(GameObjectTypes gameObjectTypes,
                           long backoff)
        Instead of immediately spawning elements this method will wait and then call manualSpawn. It will run in separate thread to prevent blocking.
        Parameters:
        backoff - milliseconds to sleep
